author: Steve Newman
comment: When using the app in Sensor only mode (using heart rate monitor) in doors, I found that the unit was still searching for a GPS signal. The Category was set to Running Treadmill while indoors, so Distance is not tracked, would be helpful if stats like pace and distance could be manually updated. The ability to customize what is displayed on wearable android watches would be awesome.
title: Better indoor support needed

author: Havana Cubanno
comment: I've been using this for a long time after quite a few paid apps that fail to meet my needs.  Pros: easy to use, easy setup, pairs with HR monitor easily, can be uploaded to any social media or just use for yourself off the grid.  Lots of realtime data & graphs INCLUDED IN THE APP (you've already paid once, why use other apps where you pay a monthly fee for charts?).
title: Best There is.... Enough said

author: Matthew
comment: I have been using Sports tracker live for years and haven't found an app quite like this. (basically an offline version of sports tracker live) I love that I can finally manage my own data! =]   Support this developer! He is doing all the right things and listens to his customers!
title: Great App and Developer!

author: Gar Nelson
comment: I've used SportsTrackLive for the past year. Of everything I've tried, I think STL has a noticeably better user interface / display. I only had one complaint - archiving my past workouts had to go through the STL website first. Now, with FitCloud, that is no longer the case. Kudos to the developer and thank you!
title: Outstanding Application

author: Craig Steeland
comment: I have tried ten different fitness apps.  All have had drawbacks, not least the fact that many require a monthly subscription to make certain features available.  FitCloud provides features for a one-off payment which are normally only available to subscribers to other apps.  These include the ability to set a GPS offset value to correct GPS readings to make altitude measurements more accurate, and good maps and graphs of each activity.  FIles are stored locally and are easily converted to KML or GPX files for use with other apps and programs.    Note that there are no social networking features, so this app may not be for everyone.  But if you don't need social networking, then this might be the app for you.    This app needs to have the ability to import tracks from other apps.  It would then get five stars from me.
title: Very Good Non-Subscription Fitness App

author: Eric Crescimano
comment: I'm so happy the Dev turned SportsTracker Pro into this app. It's the most feature complete tracker for Android and now I can sync the data to three online services I use most work my friends! Plus I control all the data with ease! Love it!
title: Best tracking app!

author: raka chandraditya
comment: Ant+ sensor keep disconnected after about 9 minutes. Please fix this

author: Jason Weaver
comment: I know STP is the best run tracking app I've used. Glad to see it evolve this way and I'm happy to support a great developer!
title: Thousands of Miles Later...

author: Bill Bagnell
comment: By far the best cycling app for Android. As SportsTrackLive it only uploaded to its own website but now, with the ability to export GPX and KML files, it integrates with RideWithGPS, Strava, etc. Much better than those sites' apps. I commend this developer for doing the right thing and listening to their customers. Wow! (I am not associated with the developer, just a really happy user.)
title: Everything  I ever wanted

author: Lawrence Gilsdorf
comment: This software failed to work with the  smart watch that I purchased. I could not establish Bluetooth communication no matter what settings I used on software  interface.  Plus it looks like I'm out $6.04, as well.
